message_1: If p represents the statement "Today is Wednesday" and q represents the statement "It is raining outside", write the negation of the compound statement "Today is Wednesday and it is not raining outside."
message_2: The compound statement "Today is Wednesday and it is not raining outside" can be written as p ∧ ¬q. The negation of this compound statement is ¬(p ∧ ¬q), which can be further simplified using De Morgan's law: ¬p ∨ q. This means "It is not Wednesday or it is raining outside."
